ranked_diseases.explanation: Ferguson-Smith disease is characterized by multiple self-healing squamous epitheliomas, which matches the patient's phenotypic feature.
This is another name for Ferguson-Smith disease, also characterized by self-healing squamous epitheliomas.
Although primarily associated with basal cell carcinomas, this syndrome can sometimes present with squamous cell lesions, though less commonly self-healing.
This condition predisposes to various skin neoplasms, including squamous cell carcinomas, but self-healing squamous epitheliomas are not a hallmark feature.
